Welcome to Rest API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

REST API repository Contact¶

REST_API.repository.contact.create_contact(user: User, db: Session, contact: ContactCreate)¶

Creates a new contact for the specified user.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user for whom the contact is being created.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • contact (ContactCreate) – The data for the new contact.

Returns:

The newly created contact.

REST_API.repository.contact.delete_contact(user: User, db: Session, contact_id: int)¶

Deletes a contact for the specified user.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user who owns the contact.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to delete.

Returns:

The deleted contact, or None if not found.

REST_API.repository.contact.get_contact(db: Session, contact_id: int)¶

Retrieves a single contact with the specified ID.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

Returns:

The contact with the specified ID, or None if not found.

REST_API.repository.contact.get_contacts(user: User, db: Session, skip: int = 0, limit: int = 100) → List[Contact]¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for the specified user with pagination.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user whose contacts are being retrieved.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

REST_API.repository.contact.get_upcoming_birthdays(user: User, db: Session)¶

Retrieves upcoming birthdays for the specified user.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user whose contacts’ birthdays are being checked.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts with birthdays in the next week.

REST_API.repository.contact.search_contacts(user: User, db: Session, query: str = None)¶

Searches contacts for the specified user by a given query.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user whose contacts are being searched.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • query (str) – The search query.

Returns:

A list of contacts matching the query.

REST_API.repository.contact.update_contact(user: User, db: Session, contact_id: int, contact: ContactUpdate)¶

Updates an existing contact for the specified user.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user who owns the contact.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • contact (ContactUpdate) – The updated data for the contact.

Returns:

The updated contact, or None if not found.

REST API repository Auth¶

async REST_API.repository.auth.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

Confirms the email address of a user.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address to confirm.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

async REST_API.repository.auth.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

Creates a new user with the provided data.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – The data for the new user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created user.

Return type:

User

async REST_API.repository.auth.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User¶

Retrieves a user by their email from the database.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email of the user to retrieve.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The user with the specified email.

Return type:

User

async REST_API.repository.auth.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

Updates the avatar URL for a user.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user.

  • url (str) – The new avatar URL.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated user.

Return type:

User

async REST_API.repository.auth.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

Updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user whose token is being updated.

  • token (str | None) – The new refresh token.

  • db (Session) – The database session.
